rev.comment: codenames should not replace version numbers

==Droid RAZR==
==Droid RAZR==
{{Main|Motorola Droid RAZR}}
{{Main|Motorola Droid RAZR}}
â
On October 18, 2011, Motorola and Verizon Wireless officially unveiled the Droid RAZR, calling it "the world's thinnest 4G smartphone." The phone is 7.1mm thick, features an 8 [[Megapixel|MP]] rear camera, and has a 1.2 GHz processor and 1 GB of RAM. It has a 4.3-inch qHD display with [[Super AMOLED]] Advanced technology and is powered by [[Android (operating system)|Android]] Gingerbread. The Droid RAZR will be available in early November.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://mashable.com/2011/10/18/droid-razr/ |title=Motorola Unveils Droid Razr, Worldâs Thinnest Smartphone |last=Banks |first=Emily |date=2011-10-18 |publisher=Mashable |accessdate=2011-11-18}}</ref>
+
On October 18, 2011, Motorola and Verizon Wireless officially unveiled the Droid RAZR, calling it "the world's thinnest 4G smartphone." The phone is 7.1mm thick, features an 8 [[Megapixel|MP]] rear camera, and has a 1.2 GHz processor and 1 GB of RAM. It has a 4.3-inch qHD display with [[Super AMOLED]] Advanced technology and is powered by [[Android (operating system)|Android]] 2.3. The Droid RAZR will be available in early November.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://mashable.com/2011/10/18/droid-razr/ |title=Motorola Unveils Droid Razr, Worldâs Thinnest Smartphone |last=Banks |first=Emily |date=2011-10-18 |publisher=Mashable |accessdate=2011-11-18}}</ref>
